channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report E-2023100635
item.description:
Report E-2023100635

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-26T15:12:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-20
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Approximately 1-gallon of Heavy Duty Acidic Cleaner releases inside of the trailer impacting a 1' X 1' area on the trailer floor from one, 1-gallon plastic jug that was punctured by a forklift blade. A Contractor was called in to clean-up the spill and produced two, 55-gallon fiber waste drums in the process. No storms drains or waterways were involved.

item.title: Report E-2023100544
item.description:
Report E-2023100544

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: HOLLISTER
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 9, 2023, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3098 was punctured and released approximately 467-gallons of product to the trailer interior, lift gate, and asphalt roadway. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted site. AS personnel utilized a vacuum pump to transfer the undamaged product from the damaged tote to a new tote and secured for normal transport. Crews then deployed additional granular absorbent and a neutralizing agent to the impacted trailer floor, lift gate and asphalt roadway and worked them in utilizing hand tools. All UN3098 impacted material, including the damaged tote, was collected and containerized in nine (9) 55-gallon drums and were taken to RLC-SJE to be staged and added to the facility waste stream. AS personnel secured the site and scheduled to return at a later date for pressure washing of impacted asphalt and monitor waste at RLC-SJE. On Oct 11, 2023, AS personnel arrived on-site at RLC-SJE and inspected six (6) 55-gallon drums containing UN3098 impacted material. The waste was still reacting and drums were left unsealed in an open trailer. AS personnel secured the site and scheduled to return at a later date to continue monitoring the waste at RLC-SJE. On Oct 12, 2023, AS personnel arrived on-site at RLC-SJE and inspected six (6) 55-gallon drums containing UN3098 impacted material. There was olfactory evidence that the waste was still reacting and drums were left unsealed in an open trailer. AS personnel secured the site and scheduled to return at a later date to continue monitoring the waste at RLC-SJE. On Oct 13, 2023, AS personnel arrived on-site at RLC-SJE and inspected six (6) 55-gallon drums containing UN3098 impacted material. The reaction had ceased. The impacted trailer was re-inspected and it was confirmed that no further remediation necessary at the direction of RLC personnel. AS personnel secured the site and scheduled to return at a later date to secure the waste at RLC-SJE to be added to the facility waste stream. On Oct 16, 2023, AS personnel arrived on-site at RLC-SJE and inspected six (6) 55-gallon drums containing UN3098 impacted material. The reaction had ceased and drums were secured. RLC personnel took possession of nine (9) 55-gallon drums of waste to be added to the facility waste stream.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: UNDECLARED HAZMAT PACKAGE CAME FROM UNLOAD WET AND GIVING OFF A DISTINCT ACID ODOR. GOODS CONFIRMED TO BE REGULATED. NO MARKINGS ON OUTER CARTON INDICATING SHIPPING STATUS OF GOODS. DescribePack: BOTTLE LEAKED FROM CAP ASKEW. BOTTLE NEARLY EMPTY. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL COLLECTED WITH PHNINE AND DUSTPAN. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

When inspected, two bottles inside package was found with loose caps causing leakage. DescribePack: Loose cap on plastic bottle was the cause of the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a plastic tote by management to contain the leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023081067
item.description:
Report X-2023081067

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-26T15:12:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: RIVERSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE CONTENTS WERE INSPECTED DUE TO AN ODD CENTER OF GRAVITY NOTICED DURING PACKAGE HANDLING. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWELVE 14.1 OZ FLAMMABLE BERNZOMATIC BOTTLES. THE INNER BOX WAS MARKED AS UN1075 PETROLEUM GASES, LIQUIFIED WITH A 2.1 FLAMMABLE GAS DIAMOND LABEL. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM CALIFORNIA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER C1G721, JEREMY BAKER, 1512 CIRCLE CITY DR., CORONA CA 92879.

item.title: Report I-2023090029
item.description:
Report I-2023090029

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-24T00:32:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: American Airlines
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Upon arrival of American Airlines Flight 515 at LAX from ORD, it was discovered that U.S. Mail in the cargo compartment was leaking. The smell overcame two Fleet Service Clerks who had to go to the Concentra Clinic complaining of dizziness, shortness of breath and headaches from the smell. Once the Mail was offloaded, a box containing a 1 gallon jug of Triclopyr 4, a herbicide was discovered to have leaked approximately 1 quart of its contents due to the pressure differential between the aircraft at altitude and the plastic jug.

item.title: Report I-2023090026
item.description:
Report I-2023090026

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-24T00:32:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-23
  • City: FONTANA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Oak Harbor Freight Lines
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Ruben went into the trailer with his forklift and grabbed pro: 34020449 which was directly in front of the tote. As Ruben attempted to reverse out of the trailer, the dockplate slowed him down as the plate was at a declining angle from the dock to the trailer. Ruben then rolled slightly forward and his forks punctured the tote. Package failure was puncture by forklift. Holes were about 6 inches by 2 inches. Ruben then notified Supervisor David Hutchens at 9:24 who then immediately attempted to stop the spill by using the fork lift to flip the tote on its side. David attempted to contain the leakage but realized the overwhelming volume was too much. He then used waddles from spills skits and absorbent in attempt to stop the spill. He then radioed to Mark Gonzales about the situation. Additional waddles and absorbent was placed in the yard. Mark Gonzales then informed Josh Fuentes about the situation. After Josh realized the severity of the spill he made the decision to call out Statewide Environmental to assist with the situation.
